  "description": "Hempawa Consult Limited is a fast-growing and innovative consulting firm that is focused on providing instant service and quality assurance to its clients in the core businesses of Project Management, Procurement Management, and Human Capital Management. Hempawa Consult Limited offers a professional, friendly, and supportive environment within an open-plan office free of discriminatory practices. Ambitious and hardworking, you will join a robust in-house competencies development programme aimed at encouraging all employees to reach their full potential.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Payment and Compliance Associate

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)&nbsp; (In-person role)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	Are you detail-oriented, compliance-driven, and passionate about building trust in financial systems?
	Do you thrive in structured, high-growth environments where precision and accountability matter?
	If yes, this role is for you. We are hiring a Payments &amp; Compliance Associate for a leading FinTech company transforming financial inclusion in Nigeria and across Africa. This is an in-person role based in Abuja, designed for a disciplined professional who can ensure smooth payments processing and compliance excellence.


Responsibilities
As Payments &amp; Compliance Associate, you will:


	Ensure Smooth Transactions: Monitor and process payments with accuracy and timeliness.
	Stay Compliant: Implement and enforce compliance policies aligned with CBN and global best practices.
	Risk Management: Flag irregular activities and work with internal teams to resolve issues.
	Documentation &amp; Reporting: Maintain accurate records of all financial operations and compliance activities.
	Collaborate Across Teams: Support finance, operations, and regulatory engagement units to ensure seamless delivery.


Requirements
Who We&rsquo;re Looking For:


	Experience Matters: 2&ndash;4 years in payments, compliance, or financial operations (preferably in fintech, banking, or related sectors).
	Detail-Driven: Strong attention to accuracy, documentation, and regulatory requirements.
	Regulatory Savvy: Familiarity with CBN guidelines, AML/CFT policies, and NDIC standards.
	Tech-Enabled: Comfortable using fintech apps, reporting tools, and compliance software.
	Professional Integrity: Trustworthy, discreet, and grounded in ethical practice.


Why This Role Stands Out:


	Impact: Play a critical role in safeguarding compliance and payments integrity.
	Career Path: Build your expertise in compliance with opportunities for leadership.
	Culture: Join a fintech team that values precision, innovation, and transparency.
	Rewards: Competitive plus monthly performance-based bonuses.
	Strategic Base: Abuja location, at the heart of fintech and regulatory engagement.


Method of Application

Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	Are you detail-oriented, compliance-driven, and passionate about building trust in financial systems?
	Do you thrive in structured, high-growth environments where precision and accountability matter?
	If yes, this role is for you. We are hiring a Payments & Compliance Associate for a leading FinTech company transforming financial inclusion in Nigeria and across Africa. This is an in-person role based in Abuja, designed for a disciplined professional who can ensure smooth payments processing and compliance excellence.


Responsibilities
As Payments & Compliance Associate, you will:


	Ensure Smooth Transactions: Monitor and process payments with accuracy and timeliness.
	Stay Compliant: Implement and enforce compliance policies aligned with CBN and global best practices.
	Risk Management: Flag irregular activities and work with internal teams to resolve issues.
	Documentation & Reporting: Maintain accurate records of all financial operations and compliance activities.
	Collaborate Across Teams: Support finance, operations, and regulatory engagement units to ensure seamless delivery.


Requirements
Who We’re Looking For:


	Experience Matters: 2–4 years in payments, compliance, or financial operations (preferably in fintech, banking, or related sectors).
	Detail-Driven: Strong attention to accuracy, documentation, and regulatory requirements.
	Regulatory Savvy: Familiarity with CBN guidelines, AML/CFT policies, and NDIC standards.
	Tech-Enabled: Comfortable using fintech apps, reporting tools, and compliance software.
	Professional Integrity: Trustworthy, discreet, and grounded in ethical practice.


Why This Role Stands Out:


	Impact: Play a critical role in safeguarding compliance and payments integrity.
	Career Path: Build your expertise in compliance with opportunities for leadership.
	Culture: Join a fintech team that values precision, innovation, and transparency.
	Rewards: Competitive plus monthly performance-based bonuses.
	Strategic Base: Abuja location, at the heart of fintech and regulatory engagement.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and cover letter to: jobs@hempawaconsult.com using "Application - Payments & Compliance Associate (Abuja)" as the subject of the mail.

Sales & Customer Service Representative Job at Paramount Web Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        Paramount Web (Nigeria) since its inception in 2005 takes pride in helping our clients grow their business online. Our services include domain registration, web hosting, web design, web advertising, mobile apps development, website management. As your website design provider, you can always be rest assured that you get premium quality service along with knowledgeable and dedicated webmasters determined to help you succeed in the highly competitive world of Internet technology.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales & Customer Service Representative

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview
     

            
    




	A web development company needs Sales & Customer Service Representative, who will be the frontline voice of our company, responsible for generating sales, building strong client relationships, and ensuring outstanding customer support.
	You will handle enquiries, follow-up leads, assist existing clients, and contribute to the growth of sales and customer satisfaction.


Key Responsibilities


	Reach out to prospective clients via phone calls, emails, chat, social media etc., to promote Paramount Web’s services (web design, web programming, web website maintenance, etc.).
	Qualify leads, understand client needs, present appropriate service solutions, prepare quotations.
	Close sales targets and contribute to revenue growth.
	Generate quotes and invoices
	Respond promptly to customer inquiries and complaints, resolving issues and escalating when necessary.
	Maintain accurate records of client interactions, sales activities, and customer feedback.
	Upsell or cross-sell services to existing clients where appropriate.
	Collaborate with technical and delivery teams to ensure client expectations are met.
	Provide feedback to management on customer trends, service improvements, and product ideas.


Qualifications & Skills


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree.
	Minimum of 1 - 2 years of experience in sales, customer service, or related field.
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
	Strong interpersonal skills – ability to build rapport, trust, and long-term relationships with clients.
	Good negotiation and persuasion skills.
	Ability to listen, understand, and respond effectively to customer needs and concerns.
	Goal-oriented, self-motivated, and comfortable working with sales targets.
	Basic knowledge of web services (e.g. websites, hosting, digital marketing) is a plus.
	Ability to work well in a team and adapt to changes.


What We Offer


	Salary: N100,000 - N250,000 monthly and commission scheme / bonuses tied to performance.
	Training and professional development opportunities.
	Friendly, supportive work environment.
	Opportunity for growth into senior sales or customer relations roles.
	Flexible working options — remote or hybrid.


Note
Candidates should upload:


	Their CV / Resume.
	A cover letter explaining why their are a good fit for this position.
	Any references or sales performance examples if available.
